resources.string: You don\'t have any exercises yet. Tap the + button to get started!
Tap + to track an exercise\'s progression over time

1. Lie on the bench with your eyes under the bar.
2. Grip the bar slightly wider than shoulder-width.
3. Lower the bar to mid-chest.
4. Press up explosively.

1. Place the bar on your upper back (traps).
2. Feet shoulder-width apart.
3. Lower hips and knees keeping back straight.
4. Break parallel and stand back up.
1. Hang from the bar with an overhand grip.\n2. Pull up until your chin clears the bar.\n3. Lower down under control.

1. Stand with feet hip-width apart, bar over mid-foot.
2. Bend down and grip the bar just outside your legs.
3. Keep your back straight, chest up.
4. Drive through your heels and stand up, keeping the bar close to your body.
5. Lower the bar under control.

1. Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, bar at shoulder height.
2. Grip the bar slightly wider than shoulders.
3. Brace your core and press the bar straight up.
4. Lock out arms overhead, bar over mid-foot.
5. Lower under control to shoulders.

1. Bend forward at the hips, keeping back straight.
2. Grip the bar with hands shoulder-width apart.
3. Pull the bar to your lower chest/upper abdomen.
4. Squeeze shoulder blades together at the top.
5. Lower under control.

1. Lie on bench with dumbbells at chest level.
2. Palms facing forward, elbows at 45 degrees.
3. Press dumbbells up until arms are extended.
4. Bring dumbbells together at the top.
5. Lower under control.

1. Sit or stand with dumbbells at shoulder height.
2. Palms facing forward, core braced.
3. Press dumbbells overhead until arms are extended.
4. Keep dumbbells aligned over shoulders.
5. Lower under control to shoulders.

1. Sit at lat pulldown machine, grip bar wider than shoulders.
2. Keep torso upright with slight lean back.
3. Pull bar down to upper chest.
4. Squeeze shoulder blades together.
5. Extend arms under control.

1. Set cables to chest height, grab handles.
2. Step forward, slight bend in elbows.
3. Open arms wide keeping slight elbow bend.
4. Bring hands together in front of chest.
5. Control the movement back to start.

1. Sit in leg press machine, feet shoulder-width on platform.
2. Release safety handles.
3. Lower the weight by bending knees to 90 degrees.
4. Press through heels to extend legs.
5. Don't lock out knees completely.

1. Start in plank position, hands shoulder-width apart.
2. Keep body straight from head to heels.
3. Lower chest to ground, elbows at 45 degrees.
4. Push back up to starting position.
5. Maintain core engagement throughout.

1. Start in forearm plank position.
2. Elbows directly under shoulders.
3. Keep body in straight line from head to heels.
4. Engage core, don't let hips sag or pike up.
5. Hold the position for desired time.

1. Place one knee and hand on bench for support.
2. Hold dumbbell in opposite hand, arm extended.
3. Pull dumbbell to hip, keeping elbow close to body.
4. Squeeze shoulder blade at the top.
5. Lower under control and repeat.

1. Stand with dumbbells at sides, palms facing forward.
2. Keep elbows close to torso.
3. Curl weights up to shoulders without moving upper arms.
4. Squeeze biceps at the top.
5. Lower under control to starting position.

1. Hold one dumbbell with both hands overhead.
2. Keep elbows pointing forward, close to head.
3. Lower dumbbell behind head by bending elbows.
4. Extend arms back to starting position.
5. Keep upper arms stationary throughout.

1. Stand with dumbbells at sides, slight bend in elbows.
2. Keep torso stationary and core engaged.
3. Raise dumbbells to sides until arms parallel to floor.
4. Lead with elbows, not hands.
5. Lower under control to starting position.

1. Hold bar at hip level with overhand grip.
2. Keep knees slightly bent throughout movement.
3. Hinge at hips, lowering bar down front of legs.
4. Feel stretch in hamstrings, back stays straight.
5. Drive hips forward to return to standing.

1. Rest bar on front of shoulders, elbows high.
2. Keep torso upright, core tight.
3. Squat down keeping weight on heels.
4. Keep elbows up and chest proud throughout.
5. Drive through heels to stand back up.

1. Lie face down on leg curl machine.
2. Position pad just above ankles.
3. Curl legs up toward glutes.
4. Squeeze hamstrings at the top.
5. Lower under control without letting weight stack touch.

1. Sit in leg extension machine, back against pad.
2. Position pad on lower shins.
3. Extend legs until knees are straight.
4. Squeeze quadriceps at the top.
5. Lower under control to starting position.

1. Grip parallel bars, arms extended supporting body.
2. Lean slightly forward for chest emphasis.
3. Lower body by bending elbows to 90 degrees.
4. Keep elbows at about 45-degree angle.
5. Press back up to starting position.

1. Set cable at upper chest height with rope attachment.
2. Grab rope with overhand grip, step back.
3. Pull rope toward face, separating hands at end.
4. Focus on pulling elbows back and squeezing rear delts.
5. Return under control to starting position.

1. Sit on ground with upper back against bench, bar over hips.
2. Plant feet flat, shoulder-width apart.
3. Drive through heels, lifting hips until body forms straight line.
4. Squeeze glutes hard at the top.
5. Lower hips under control without touching ground.

1. Set bench to 30-45 degree angle.
2. Lie back, grip bar slightly wider than shoulders.
3. Lower bar to upper chest.
4. Press bar up and slightly back.
5. Keep shoulder blades retracted throughout.

1. Position shoulders under pads, balls of feet on platform.
2. Start with heels below platform level.
3. Rise up onto toes as high as possible.
4. Pause and squeeze calves at the top.
5. Lower heels below platform for full stretch.

1. Lie on bench holding bar with narrow grip.
2. Extend arms straight up over chest.
3. Lower bar toward forehead by bending elbows only.
4. Keep upper arms stationary and perpendicular to floor.
5. Extend arms back to starting position.

1. Stand with dumbbells at sides, palms facing each other.
2. Keep elbows close to torso.
3. Curl weights up without rotating wrists.
4. Maintain neutral grip throughout movement.
5. Lower under control to starting position.

1. Stand holding dumbbells at sides with arms straight.
2. Keep arms extended throughout movement.
3. Elevate shoulders straight up toward ears.
4. Hold peak contraction for 1-2 seconds.
5. Lower shoulders under control.

1. Hold dumbbells at sides, place rear foot on bench behind you.
2. Front foot far enough forward for comfortable stance.
3. Lower hips by bending front knee to 90 degrees.
4. Keep torso upright, weight on front heel.
5. Drive through front heel to return to start.

1. Hold dumbbells at sides, stand with feet together.
2. Step forward with one leg into lunge position.
3. Lower back knee toward ground, front thigh parallel to floor.
4. Push through front heel to step forward with rear leg.
5. Alternate legs with each forward step.

1. Stand facing cable machine with rope or bar attachment.
2. Grip attachment with elbows at sides.
3. Push down until arms are fully extended.
4. Keep elbows stationary throughout movement.
5. Return under control without letting elbows move forward.

1. Lie face down on incline bench or machine pad.
2. Grip handles with arms extended.
3. Pull handles toward lower chest.
4. Squeeze shoulder blades together at the top.
5. Extend arms under control to starting position.

1. Kneel in front of cable machine with rope attachment.
2. Hold rope beside head or behind neck.
3. Crunch down by contracting abs, bringing elbows toward knees.
4. Keep hips stationary throughout movement.
5. Return under control to starting position.

1. Hang from pull-up bar with straight arms.
2. Keep legs together, slight bend in knees.
3. Raise legs up by contracting abs until parallel to floor.
4. Avoid swinging or using momentum.
5. Lower legs under control to starting position.

1. Sit on floor, lean back slightly, feet elevated.
2. Hold weight with both hands at chest.
3. Rotate torso to one side, touching weight to floor.
4. Rotate to opposite side in controlled motion.
5. Keep core engaged and chest up throughout.

1. Sit facing machine pad, chest against support.
2. Grip handles with arms extended forward.
3. Pull handles back, leading with elbows.
4. Squeeze shoulder blades and rear delts together.
5. Return under control to starting position.

1. Stand sideways to cable machine, grab handle with far hand.
2. Start with hand across body, slight bend in elbow.
3. Raise arm out to side until parallel to floor.
4. Lead with elbow, maintain constant tension.
5. Lower under control across body.

1. Sit with back against pad, forearms on pads.
2. Keep elbows at shoulder height.
3. Bring pads together in front of chest.
4. Squeeze chest at peak contraction.
5. Return to starting position with control.

1. Sit at cable row machine, feet on platform.
2. Grip handles with arms extended.
3. Pull handles to lower chest/upper abdomen.
4. Squeeze shoulder blades together at the back.
5. Extend arms forward under control.

1. Sit in machine with back against pad.
2. Grip handles at shoulder height.
3. Press handles up until arms are extended.
4. Keep core tight and back against pad.
5. Lower under control to starting position.

1. Sit on rowing machine, feet strapped in.
2. Grip handle with arms extended, knees bent.
3. Push with legs first, then pull handle to chest.
4. Extend arms, bend knees, and slide forward.
5. Maintain smooth, controlled rhythm throughout.

1. Lie perpendicular on bench, only upper back supported.
2. Hold one dumbbell with both hands above chest.
3. Lower dumbbell behind head in arc motion, slight elbow bend.
4. Feel stretch in lats and chest.
5. Pull dumbbell back over chest using lats and chest.

1. Sit at preacher curl station, arms over pad.
2. Grip bar with underhand grip, arms extended.
3. Curl weight up by contracting biceps.
4. Keep upper arms pressed against pad throughout.
5. Lower under control to full extension.

1. Attach weight to dip belt or hold dumbbell between feet.
2. Hang from bar with overhand grip.
3. Pull up until chin clears bar.
4. Control the descent with added weight.
5. Maintain strict form despite extra resistance.

1. Attach weight to dip belt around waist.
2. Grip parallel bars, arms extended.
3. Lower body by bending elbows to 90 degrees.
4. Press back up to starting position.
5. Keep torso stable with added weight.

1. Sit on bench, place elbow against inner thigh.
2. Hold dumbbell with arm fully extended.
3. Curl weight up toward shoulder.
4. Focus on peak contraction at the top.
5. Lower slowly, maintaining contact with thigh.

1. Lie on decline bench (15-30 degrees), feet secured.
2. Grip bar slightly wider than shoulders.
3. Lower bar to lower chest.
4. Press bar up and slightly back.
5. Keep feet anchored and core tight throughout.

1. Sit with dumbbells at shoulder height, palms facing you.
2. Press dumbbells up while rotating palms forward.
3. Finish with palms forward, arms extended overhead.
4. Reverse motion, rotating palms back toward you.
5. Lower to starting position with palms facing in.

1. Hold dumbbell vertically at chest, both hands under top weight.
2. Stand with feet slightly wider than shoulder-width.
3. Squat down keeping chest up, elbows inside knees.
4. Push knees out, maintain upright torso.
5. Drive through heels to stand back up.

1. Hold heavy dumbbells at sides with straight arms.
2. Stand tall with shoulders back, core engaged.
3. Walk forward with controlled steps.
4. Keep dumbbells from swinging.
5. Maintain posture throughout for desired distance.

1. Stand facing box or platform at appropriate height.
2. Bend knees into quarter squat position.
3. Explosively jump onto box, landing softly with both feet.
4. Stand fully upright on box.
5. Step down carefully and reset for next rep.

1. Stand at cable machine with high pulley.
2. Grip handle with both hands, step back for tension.
3. Pull handle to upper chest with elbows high.
4. Squeeze shoulder blades together.
5. Return under control to starting position.

1. Lie on bench holding dumbbells above chest.
2. Keep slight bend in elbows throughout movement.
3. Lower dumbbells out to sides in wide arc.
4. Feel stretch in chest at bottom.
5. Bring dumbbells back together above chest.

1. Set bench to 30-45 degree angle.
2. Hold dumbbells at shoulder level, palms forward.
3. Press dumbbells up until arms extended.
4. Bring dumbbells together at top.
5. Lower under control to shoulders.

1. Set cables to high position, grab handles.
2. Step forward with staggered stance.
3. Bring handles down and across body in arc motion.
4. Cross hands in front of lower chest.
5. Return under control keeping tension on cables.

1. Sit in rowing machine, chest against pad.
2. Grip handles with arms extended.
3. Pull handles back toward torso.
4. Squeeze shoulder blades together hard.
5. Extend arms forward under control.

1. Stand holding EZ bar with underhand grip at curves.
2. Keep elbows close to sides.
3. Curl bar up to shoulders.
4. Squeeze biceps at peak contraction.
5. Lower under control to starting position.

1. Stand facing cable machine with low pulley.
2. Grip bar or handle with underhand grip.
3. Curl handle up keeping elbows stationary.
4. Maintain constant tension throughout.
5. Lower under control without letting weight stack touch.

1. Stand with dumbbells at shoulder height.
2. Brace core, feet shoulder-width apart.
3. Press dumbbells overhead until arms extended.
4. Keep dumbbells aligned over shoulders.
5. Lower under control to shoulders.

1. Hold barbell at thigh level with overhand grip.
2. Keep arms straight throughout movement.
3. Elevate shoulders straight up toward ears.
4. Hold peak contraction for 1-2 seconds.
5. Lower shoulders under control.

1. Stand with dumbbells in front of thighs, palms facing body.
2. Keep slight bend in elbows, core engaged.
3. Raise dumbbells forward to shoulder height.
4. Keep arms parallel to floor at top.
5. Lower under control to starting position.

1. Straddle T-bar with bent-over position.
2. Grip handles with both hands.
3. Pull weight toward chest, elbows close to body.
4. Squeeze shoulder blades together at top.
5. Lower under control to full extension.

1. Position yourself in back extension station, ankles secured.
2. Cross arms over chest or behind head.
3. Lower torso by bending at hips.
4. Raise back up until body forms straight line.
5. Avoid hyperextending, maintain neutral spine.

1. Hold dumbbell in one hand, stand on opposite leg.
2. Hinge at hip, extending free leg behind for balance.
3. Lower dumbbell toward ground, back straight.
4. Feel stretch in hamstring of standing leg.
5. Drive through standing heel to return upright.

1. Stand at cable machine with D-handle at chest height.
2. Grip handle with one hand, feet staggered.
3. Pull handle to side of torso, rotating slightly.
4. Squeeze shoulder blade back.
5. Extend arm under control, maintain tension.

1. Hang from bar with underhand (supinated) grip.
2. Grip shoulder-width or slightly narrower.
3. Pull up until chin clears bar.
4. Emphasizes biceps more than overhand pull-ups.
5. Lower under control to full extension.

1. Place barbell on upper back like squat position.
2. Stand with feet shoulder-width, slight knee bend.
3. Hinge at hips, pushing hips back.
4. Lower torso until parallel to floor, back straight.
5. Drive hips forward to return to standing.

1. Set barbell in rack at knee height.
2. Grip bar just outside legs, stand close.
3. Pull bar up by extending hips and straightening back.
4. Focus on upper back and trap engagement.
5. Lower bar back to rack pins with control.

1. Sit in leg press machine, place one foot on platform.
2. Other leg rests to the side or on floor.
3. Lower weight by bending knee to 90 degrees.
4. Press through heel to extend leg.
5. Complete all reps before switching legs.

1. Sit in hip adduction machine, pads on inner thighs.
2. Start with legs apart, knees at outer position.
3. Squeeze legs together by contracting adductors.
4. Bring knees as close as machine allows.
5. Return under control to starting position.

1. Sit in hip abduction machine, pads on outer thighs.
2. Start with legs together.
3. Push legs apart by contracting abductors and glutes.
4. Open legs as wide as machine allows.
5. Return under control to starting position.

1. Sit in neck machine or use head harness with weight.
2. Place pad against back of head.
3. Extend head backward against resistance.
4. Contract neck extensors fully.
5. Return to neutral position under control.

1. Lie face up on bench or sit in neck machine.
2. Place pad against forehead.
3. Curl head forward by contracting neck flexors.
4. Bring chin toward chest.
5. Return to neutral position under control.

1. Kneel on floor holding ab wheel handles.
2. Roll wheel forward, extending body.
3. Keep core tight, avoid sagging hips.
4. Roll out as far as control allows.
5. Pull back to starting position using abs.

1. Lie on back, knees bent, feet flat.
2. Place hands behind head or across chest.
3. Curl torso up toward knees.
4. Lift shoulder blades off ground completely.
5. Lower back down under control.

1. Secure feet in decline bench, lie back.
2. Place hands behind head or across chest.
3. Curl torso up against gravity.
4. Increased difficulty due to decline angle.
5. Lower back down under control.

1. Lie on back holding weight plate on chest.
2. Knees bent, feet flat on floor.
3. Crunch up by contracting abs.
4. Lift shoulders off ground, not full sit-up.
5. Lower under control, maintain tension.

1. Lie on side, prop up on forearm.
2. Stack feet or stagger for stability.
3. Lift hips off ground, body forms straight line.
4. Engage obliques to maintain position.
5. Hold for desired time, switch sides.

1. Sit at lat pulldown with wide bar attachment.
2. Grip bar wider than shoulder-width, overhand.
3. Pull bar down to upper chest.
4. Focus on lat width development.
5. Extend arms under control.

1. Use V-bar or close grip attachment.
2. Grip handles with palms facing each other.
3. Pull attachment to upper chest.
4. Emphasizes lower lats and thickness.
5. Extend arms under control.

1. Stand at cable machine with straight bar.
2. Keep slight bend in elbows, arms extended.
3. Pull bar down in arc motion to thighs.
4. Focus on lat contraction, no elbow bend.
5. Return under control to starting position.

1. Bend forward at hips, support with one hand.
2. Hold dumbbell with elbow bent at 90 degrees.
3. Extend arm back until fully straight.
4. Squeeze tricep at full extension.
5. Lower under control to starting position.

1. Attach rope to high cable pulley.
2. Grip rope ends with neutral grip.
3. Push down and out, separating rope at bottom.
4. Fully extend arms, squeeze triceps.
5. Return under control without letting elbows move.

1. Grip barbell with underhand (supinated) grip.
2. Bend forward at hips, back straight.
3. Pull bar to lower chest/upper abdomen.
4. Emphasizes lower lats and biceps.
5. Lower under control to full extension.

1. Use parallel handles or V-bar attachment.
2. Grip handles with palms facing each other.
3. Pull up until chin clears handles.
4. Easier on shoulders than overhand grip.
5. Lower under control to full extension.

1. Set cables at shoulder height.
2. Cross arms and grab opposite handles.
3. Pull handles back and out to sides.
4. Squeeze rear delts and shoulder blades.
5. Return under control maintaining tension.

1. Use straight bar with underhand grip.
2. Keep elbows at sides, palms facing up.
3. Push bar down until arms fully extended.
4. Emphasizes medial head of triceps.
5. Return under control without moving elbows.

1. Attach rope to high pulley.
2. Grip rope ends, step back for tension.
3. Pull rope toward face, separating ends.
4. Focus on external rotation and rear delts.
5. Return under control maintaining tension.

1. Stand with wide stance, toes pointed out.
2. Grip bar with hands inside legs.
3. Keep torso more upright than conventional deadlift.
4. Drive through heels, emphasizing glutes and inner thighs.
5. Lock out at top, lower under control.

1. Place one end of barbell in landmine or corner.
2. Hold other end at shoulder height.
3. Press bar up and forward in arc motion.
4. Keep core tight, can be done standing or kneeling.
5. Lower under control to shoulder.

1. Lie back on incline bench (45 degrees).
2. Hold dumbbells with arms hanging straight down.
3. Curl weights up without moving upper arms.
4. Full stretch at bottom, maximum bicep activation.
5. Lower under control to full extension.

1. Lie on decline bench, feet secured.
2. Hold dumbbells at chest level, palms forward.
3. Press dumbbells up until arms extended.
4. Targets lower chest effectively.
5. Lower under control to chest level.

1. Set cable at high position.
2. Stand sideways to machine, grip handle with both hands.
3. Pull cable down and across body in chopping motion.
4. Rotate torso, engage core and obliques.
5. Return under control, repeat other side.

1. Stand with feet shoulder-width, hold support for balance.
2. Lean back while bending knees forward.
3. Lower body while keeping thighs and torso aligned.
4. Extreme quad stretch and activation.
5. Push through toes to return to start.

1. Lie face down on elevated bench.
2. Grip barbell hanging below bench.
3. Pull bar to lower chest.
4. Completely removes lower back from movement.
5. Lower under control to full extension.

1. Stand with dumbbells at sides, palms forward.
2. Curl weights up with standard grip.
3. At top, rotate wrists so palms face down.
4. Lower with reverse grip for forearm emphasis.
5. Rotate back to standard grip at bottom.

1. Set up like standard back squat.
2. Descend to parallel or below.
3. Pause for 2-3 seconds at bottom.
4. Eliminates bounce, builds strength from dead stop.
5. Drive up explosively to standing.

1. Lie on back, knees bent, feet flat on floor.
2. Place weight across hips if desired.
3. Drive through heels, lifting hips toward ceiling.
4. Squeeze glutes hard at top.
5. Lower hips under control, repeat.

1. Attach ankle cuff to low cable pulley.
2. Face machine, hold handles for support.
3. Kick leg back, squeezing glute at full extension.
4. Keep core tight, avoid arching lower back.
5. Return under control, repeat other leg.

1. Set cables to lowest position.
2. Grab handles, step forward with staggered stance.
3. Bring handles up and together in arc motion.
4. Targets upper chest emphasis.
5. Return under control maintaining tension.

1. Set cables to highest position.
2. Grab handles, step forward with staggered stance.
3. Bring handles down and together in arc motion.
4. Targets lower chest emphasis.
5. Return under control maintaining tension.

1. Bend forward at hips, back straight.
2. Hold dumbbells with slight bend in elbows.
3. Raise dumbbells out to sides in arc motion.
4. Squeeze rear delts and shoulder blades.
5. Lower under control to starting position.

1. Lie on bench, grip bar at shoulder-width or narrower.
2. Lower bar to lower chest.
3. Keep elbows closer to body than regular bench.
4. Emphasizes triceps more than chest.
5. Press up explosively.

1. Use wide bar attachment on cable row.
2. Sit with feet on platform, grip bar wide.
3. Pull bar to upper chest with wide elbow position.
4. Emphasizes upper back and rear delts.
5. Extend arms under control.

1. Set bench to 30-45 degree angle.
2. Grip bar slightly wider than shoulders.
3. Lower bar to upper chest.
4. Press bar up and slightly back.
5. Targets upper chest development.

1. Position shoulders under pads, balls of feet on platform.
2. Stand tall, core engaged.
3. Rise up onto toes as high as possible.
4. Pause and squeeze calves at top.
5. Lower heels below platform for full stretch.

1. Sit in machine, place knees under pads.
2. Balls of feet on platform, heels hanging.
3. Push up onto toes by contracting calves.
4. Different emphasis than standing variation.
5. Lower heels below platform for stretch.

1. Stand or sit holding dumbbell at shoulder height.
2. Press dumbbell overhead with one arm.
3. Keep core tight to resist rotation.
4. Full extension at top.
5. Lower under control, complete set before switching.

1. Sit on bench, forearms resting on thighs.
2. Hold barbell with underhand grip, wrists hanging.
3. Curl wrists up by contracting forearms.
4. Only wrists move, forearms stay on thighs.
5. Lower under control to full stretch.

1. Sit on bench, forearms resting on thighs.
2. Hold barbell with overhand grip, wrists hanging.
3. Curl wrists up using top of forearms.
4. Targets extensors, balances forearm development.
5. Lower under control to starting position.

1. Sit in chest press machine, adjust seat height.
2. Grip handles at chest level.
3. Press handles forward until arms extended.
4. Safer alternative to free weight pressing.
5. Return under control to starting position.

1. Stand holding barbell at thighs with overhand grip.
2. Pull bar straight up along body to chin level.
3. Keep elbows higher than wrists.
4. Targets traps and side delts.
5. Lower under control to starting position.

1. Stand sideways to cable machine at chest height.
2. Hold handle with both hands, arms extended.
3. Rotate torso away from machine.
4. Keep hips stable, only torso rotates.
5. Return under control, repeat other side.

1. Lie on back, hands behind head.
2. Lift shoulders off ground, knees bent.
3. Bring opposite elbow to opposite knee in cycling motion.
4. Alternate sides in controlled rhythm.
5. Keep core engaged throughout.

1. Lie face down in leg curl machine.
2. Position one leg under pad, other leg off to side.
3. Curl leg up toward glutes.
4. Isolates each hamstring independently.
5. Lower under control, complete set before switching.

1. Start standing, drop into squat position.
2. Place hands on ground, jump feet back to plank.
3. Perform push-up (optional).
4. Jump feet back to squat, explode upward.
5. Full body conditioning exercise.

1. Start with bar on floor, deadlift setup.
2. Pull bar explosively, extending hips and knees.
3. Shrug shoulders, pull yourself under bar.
4. Catch bar at shoulders in quarter squat.
5. Stand up to complete rep, lower with control.

1. Set desired speed and incline on treadmill.
2. Start walking, gradually increase to running pace.
3. Maintain proper running form throughout.
4. Use incline to increase intensity.
5. Cool down by gradually reducing speed.

1. Adjust seat height so knee has slight bend at bottom.
2. Set desired resistance level.
3. Pedal at steady pace maintaining resistance.
4. Can do intervals or steady state cardio.
5. Monitor heart rate and adjust intensity.

1. Step onto elliptical, grip handles.
2. Set desired resistance and incline.
3. Move in smooth elliptical motion.
4. Low-impact alternative to running.
5. Engage arms by pushing and pulling handles.

1. Step onto machine, set desired speed.
2. Climb stairs at steady pace.
3. Avoid leaning heavily on rails.
4. Great for glutes and cardiovascular fitness.
5. Maintain upright posture throughout.

1. Sit at lat pulldown, grip bar wide.
2. Pull bar down in front to upper chest.
3. Lean back slightly, about 30 degrees.
4. Standard lat pulldown variation.
5. Extend arms under control.

1. Position back against pad, shoulders under pads.
2. Place feet on platform shoulder-width apart.
3. Release safety handles, lower by bending knees.
4. Descend until thighs parallel to platform.
5. Press through heels to return to start.

1. Position bar on upper back, feet slightly forward.
2. Unrack bar by rotating hooks.
3. Descend into squat, bar travels in fixed path.
4. Safer alternative to free weight squats.
5. Rotate bar to re-rack at any height.

1. Sit in machine, adjust pad behind lower legs.
2. Position legs extended in front.
3. Curl legs down by contracting hamstrings.
4. Different angle than lying leg curl.
5. Extend legs under control to starting position.

1. Start in plank position, hands under shoulders.
2. Drive one knee toward chest explosively.
3. Quickly switch legs in running motion.
4. Keep core tight, hips level.
5. Full body conditioning exercise.

1. Stand with feet shoulder-width apart.
2. Descend into squat position.
3. Explode upward, jumping off ground.
4. Land softly, absorbing impact with squat.
5. Immediately go into next rep.

1. Lie on bench under Smith machine bar.
2. Grip bar slightly wider than shoulders.
3. Unrack by rotating bar, lower to chest.
4. Fixed path allows focus on chest contraction.
5. Press up and rotate to re-rack.

1. Sit on bench under Smith machine bar.
2. Grip bar at shoulder width.
3. Unrack and press bar overhead.
4. Fixed vertical path, safer than free weights.
5. Lower to shoulders and repeat.

1. Set bar at knee height in Smith machine.
2. Bend forward at hips, grip bar.
3. Pull bar to lower chest.
4. Fixed path helps maintain form.
5. Lower under control to starting position.

1. Sit in leg press, feet close together on platform.
2. Release safety handles.
3. Lower weight by bending knees.
4. Emphasizes outer quads more.
5. Press through heels to extend legs.

1. Sit in leg press, feet wide on platform, toes out.
2. Release safety handles.
3. Lower weight by bending knees.
4. Emphasizes inner quads and adductors.
5. Press through heels to extend legs.

1. Sit in leg press, place feet high on platform.
2. Release safety handles.
3. Lower weight by bending knees.
4. Emphasizes glutes and hamstrings more.
5. Press through heels to extend legs.

1. Lie on bench, grip behind head for stability.
2. Raise entire body off bench, only shoulders remain.
3. Keep body straight from shoulders to feet.
4. Lower body under control, maintaining rigid position.
5. Advanced core exercise, extreme difficulty.

1. Hang from pull-up bar with false grip.
2. Explosive pull-up, bringing chest to bar.
3. Transition from pull to dip position.
4. Press body above bar into support position.
5. Advanced calisthenics movement combining pull-up and dip.

1. Hang from pull-up bar with overhand grip.
2. Engage core and lats intensely.
3. Raise body parallel to ground, face up.
4. Keep body completely straight and horizontal.
5. Hold position, advanced calisthenics skill.

1. Position rear foot on bench behind Smith machine.
2. Stand under bar, front foot forward.
3. Lower by bending front knee to 90 degrees.
4. Fixed path ensures stability.
5. Press through front heel to return.

1. Stand on one leg, other leg extended forward.
2. Lower into squat on single leg.
3. Keep extended leg off ground throughout.
4. Descend as low as possible.
5. Drive through heel to stand, advanced movement.

1. Set bench to 30-45 degrees under Smith bar.
2. Lie back, grip bar at shoulder width.
3. Unrack and lower bar to upper chest.
4. Fixed path targets upper chest safely.
5. Press up and rotate to re-rack.

1. Set bench to decline under Smith bar.
2. Secure feet, lie back and grip bar.
3. Unrack and lower to lower chest.
4. Fixed path targets lower chest.
5. Press up and rotate to re-rack.

1. Sit in incline chest press machine.
2. Adjust seat so handles at upper chest level.
3. Press handles forward until arms extended.
4. Targets upper chest specifically.
5. Return under control to starting position.

1. Sit in decline chest press machine.
2. Adjust seat so handles at lower chest level.
3. Press handles forward until arms extended.
4. Targets lower chest specifically.
5. Return under control to starting position.

1. Set bench to 30â€“45 degrees between cables.
2. Set cables to low position.
3. Lie back, bring handles together above upper chest.
4. Targets upper chest with fly motion.
5. Lower in arc motion maintaining tension.

1. Set bench to decline between cables.
2. Set cables to high position.
3. Lie back, bring handles together at lower chest.
4. Targets lower chest with fly motion.
5. Lower in arc motion maintaining tension.

1. Sit in machine fly, back against pad.
2. Adjust handles to chest height.
3. Bring handles together in front of chest.
4. Squeeze chest at peak contraction.
5. Return under control to stretch position.

1. Sit in pullover machine with back against pad.
2. Place arms on pads or grip handles.
3. Pull down in an arc motion to your torso.
4. Feel the stretch in lats and chest at top.
5. Control the movement back to starting position.

1. Attach rope to high pulley.
2. Stand facing away, lean forward slightly.
3. Pull rope down in arc motion to hips.
4. Keep arms slightly bent throughout.
5. Control return to stretch position.

1. Attach straight or EZ bar to high pulley.
2. Stand facing away, lean forward slightly.
3. Pull bar down in arc motion to thighs.
4. Keep arms slightly bent throughout.
5. Control return to stretch position.

1. Set cable to low position, face away from machine.
2. Grip rope or bar overhead with both hands.
3. Step forward to create tension.
4. Extend arms overhead, keeping elbows stationary.
5. Lower under control behind head.

1. Set cable to low position, face away from machine.
2. Grip handle with one hand overhead.
3. Step forward to create tension.
4. Extend arm overhead, keeping elbow stationary.
5. Lower under control behind head, repeat other side.
Cable Overhead Triceps Extension with Cuff (Unilateral)

1. Attach ankle cuff to wrist or use wrist cuff.
2. Set cable to low position, face away.
3. Position arm overhead with cuff attached.
4. Extend arm overhead, keeping elbow stationary.
5. Lower under control behind head.

1. Sit in overhead triceps extension machine.
2. Adjust seat so arms align with pivot point.
3. Grip handles overhead or behind head.
4. Extend arms upward, squeezing triceps.
5. Lower under control to starting position.
